overview: From 2025-06-15 to 2025-06-22, elizaos/eliza had 93 new PRs (71 merged), 18 new issues, and 38 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Callback from plugin action not making it to end user response in chat
topIssues.author: jonathanprozzi
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

In using the `plugin-evm` transfer function we expect to see a followup message with either the success or failure of the transaction.

In the plugin's `transfer.ts` callback, we see the following:

https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-evm/blob/6bf9c4c54b9e1a558c7fb092f071f2e374435887/src/actions/transfer.ts#L133

```typescript
 if (callback) {
        callback({
          text: `Successfully transferred ${paramOptions.amount} tokens to ${paramOptions.toAddress}\nTransaction Hash: ${transferResp.hash}`,
          content: {
            success: true,
            hash: transferResp.hash,
            amount: formatEther(transferResp.value),
            recipient: transferResp.to,
            chain: paramOptions.fromChain,
          },
        });
      }
... (other error logging as well)
```

We see the following in our logs (added additional debugging console.log statements):

```bash
LOG:in the transfer action
CALLBACK IN EVM_TRANSFER_TOKENS [AsyncFunction (anonymous)]
in the transferResponse try block
transferResponse try block completed {
  hash: '0xd2680982067e0258612119a58497208428613debcd314d667bd758b93ea86ed8',
  from: '0x7850f8a9825d6dadfF5621300ee11f2dED76b76b',
  to: '0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94',
  value: 20000000000000000n,
  data: '0x'
}
[2025-06-09 19:25:35] INFO: [Eliza] Agent generated response for message. Preparing to send back to bus.
[2025-06-09 19:25:35] INFO: [Eliza] MessageBusService: Sending payload to central server API endpoint (/api/messages/submit):
    channel_id: "93487822-03c0-4119-bffc-13aca04fb41f"
    server_id: "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
    author_id: "b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d"
    content: "I'll help you transfer 0.02 ETH to 0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94 on Sepolia. Processing the transaction now."
    in_reply_to_message_id: "18489676-ba76-4673-9a39-9f17fe686bc3"
    source_type: "agent_response"
    raw_message: {
      "text": "I'll help you transfer 0.02 ETH to 0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94 on Sepolia. Processing the transaction now.",
      "thought": "Process ETH transfer request on Sepolia network after checking balance",
      "actions": [
        "REPLY",
        "EVM_TRANSFER_TOKENS"
      ]
    }
    metadata: {
      "agent_id": "b850bc30-45f8-0041-a00a-83df46d8555d",
      "agentName": "Eliza",
      "channelType": "DM",
      "isDm": true
    }

```

The transfer is successful, but we only see the initial message of `"text": "I'll help you transfer 0.02 ETH to 0x25709998B542f1Be27D19Fa0B3A9A67302bc1b94 on Sepolia. Processing the transaction now.",` in the Eliza chat interface.

We would expect to see a followup message with the success (or failure) text from the callback in the `transfer.ts` function.

We also triggered an unsuccessful transaction and did not receive a followup error message which the callback suggests we should see.

**To Reproduce**

- Bare Eliza scaffolded as a fresh project with the `plugin-anthropic` and `plugin-evm` added:

```bash
    "@elizaos/cli": "^1.0.6",
    "@elizaos/core": "^1.0.6",
    "@elizaos/plugin-anthropic": "^1.0.0",
    "@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap": "^1.0.6",
    "@elizaos/plugin-evm": "file:../plugin-evm",
    "@elizaos/plugin-knowledge": "^1.0.1",
    "@elizaos/plugin-openai": "^1.0.3",
    "@elizaos/plugin-sql": "^1.0.6",
    "zod": "3.24.2"
```

and the following Character config:

```typescript
 name: 'Eliza',
  plugins: [
    '@elizaos/plugin-sql',
    ...(process.env.EVM_PRIVATE_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-evm'] : []),
    ...(process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-anthropic'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-openai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-knowledge'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY ? ['@elizaos/plugin-local-ai'] : []),
    ...(process.env.DISCORD_API_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-discord'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TWITTER_USERNAME ? ['@elizaos/plugin-twitter'] : []),
    ...(process.env.TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN ? ['@elizaos/plugin-telegram'] : []),
    ...(!process.env.IGNORE_BOOTSTRAP ? ['@elizaos/plugin-bootstrap'] : []),
  ],
  settings: {
    secrets: {},
    chains: {
      evm: ['sepolia'],
    },
    ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY,
    ANTHROPIC_SMALL_MODEL: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-latest',
    ANTHROPIC_LARGE_MODEL: 'claude-3-5-sonnet-latest',
  },

```
Our private key and RPC are configured and work as the transfer is successful.


**Expected behavior**

Based on the callback in `transfer.ts` we expect to see a followup message indicating the success or failure of the transfer call.

**Screenshots**

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/06dae3fa-9b2c-4e49-b660-42f2d9f9837f)

At this stage, the transfer succeeds but this is the last message we received.

We would expect that there would be a followup message after this indicating the success or the failure, including (or similar to) the text in the `transfer.ts` callback (in the `plugin-evm` plugin):

`Successfully transferred ${paramOptions.amount} tokens to ${paramOptions.toAddress}\nTransaction Hash: ${transferResp.hash}`

**Additional context**

We're under the impression that this is a core callback issue and not with the `plugin-evm` itself as we're seeing similar behavior with a barebones example using the `plugin-mcp`. This is a more direct and more easily reproducible example to file.

topIssues.title: /api/agents/{agentId}/rooms -> API endpoint not found
topIssues.author: exitsimulation
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to call the /rooms endpoint on my existing agent and getting a 404:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57206b48-f124-4937-98ba-5914f9e6ca59)

Here you can see that this particular agent exists:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53b4ace7-4801-497a-ace1-f8dee3569d6d)

I am on version 1.0.9

**To Reproduce**

Create agent, try to GET or POST /rooms on the agendId endpoint

**Expected behavior**

I was expecting to retrieve the rooms of the agent

**Screenshots**

(see above)

** Additional Context **

Both /logs and /memories on this particular agentId are working. Just /rooms returns the 404 "API endpoint not found" on both POST and GET
`http://localhost:3000/api/agents/b8af647b-f617-0ae3-ab07-acb81861d7e2/rooms`

topIssues.title: Knowledge management (RAG) not working (implemented) in 1.0.6
topIssues.author: harperaa
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to get rag working and following docs, but that code is not implemented in 1.0.6.  It appears to be commented as a placeholder in 
 
**To Reproduce**

settings: {
    secrets: {},
    ragKnowledge: true,
  },
  knowledge: [
    {
      directory: 'knowledge/foobar',
      shared: true,
    },
  ],

**Expected behavior**

I expect that it would parse on startup and it was not doing that, as it used to do.  So, I looked into code and found this... summary from claude....

Missing Implementation Locations

  1. AgentRuntime Initialization Missing Knowledge 
  Processing

  File: /packages/core/src/runtime.ts (lines 494-651)
  - The AgentRuntime.initialize() method should process
  character.knowledge but doesn't
  - No call to any knowledge processing function during
  agent startup

  2. TODO Comment Confirms Missing Implementation

  File: /packages/core/src/specs/v1/index.ts (line 50)
  // TODO: Implement the remaining adapters: ... - 
  knowledge / memory
  This is a developer comment explicitly stating that
  knowledge processing is not implemented yet.

  3. Bootstrap Plugin Missing KNOWLEDGE Provider

  File: /packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/index.ts
  - Multiple message examples reference providers: 
  ['KNOWLEDGE'] in character files
  - But the bootstrap plugin doesn't export any KNOWLEDGE 
  provider
  - Provider list is incomplete - missing the knowledge
  provider entirely

  4. RagService Interface Exists But No Implementation

  File: /packages/core/src/runtime.ts (lines 52-61)
  interface RagServiceDelegator extends Service {
    getKnowledge(message: Memory, scope?: { roomId?: UUID;
   worldId?: UUID; entityId?: UUID }):
  Promise<KnowledgeItem[]>;
    _internalAddKnowledge(item: KnowledgeItem, options?:
  any, scope?: any): Promise<void>;
  }
  The interface exists but no actual implementation of
  this service.

  5. Missing Functions

  - processCharacterKnowledge() - Referenced in docs but
  doesn't exist anywhere
  - No knowledge file reading/processing logic
  - No connection between character.knowledge array and
  embedding system

  Developer Comments Confirming This

  The codebase has explicit TODO comments indicating that
  knowledge/memory functionality is intentionally 
  unfinished. The character examples even reference
   a KNOWLEDGE provider that doesn't exist, suggesting
  this was planned but never implemented.

topIssues.title: Fresh install v 1.0.11  Can't add any character json files via http://localhost:3000/
topIssues.author: Megamindmaster
topIssues.body: Worked fine with v 1.0.9 tried both upgrade and fresh install to 1.0.11 global CLI. Tried everything i could think of. Maybe I'm missing something? Tried a bunch of different character files like Jarvis etc. Kept getting similar errors to this.

topPRs.title: Eliza (AGI)
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR adds everything needed to enable Eilza, a new generally capable and intelligent agent who can self-improve.

This is a mega PR that changes several things necessary to enable much more expansive capability, including action chaining. Bootstrap has been refactored to message handling. Trust, Research, Secrets, Autonomy, Autocoder, Rolodex and Todo are all in development and will be pushed shortly to enable all of this.

topPRs.title: feat: Split server package from CLI (continued shaw's PR)
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Split server functionality into separate `@elizaos/server` package
- Maintains full backward compatibility with existing CLI integrations
- Enables independent usage of server components
- Updated all CLI imports to use the new server package

## Test plan
- [x] All existing CLI tests pass
- [x] Server package builds and exports correctly
- [x] Backward compatibility maintained
- [x] Integration tests verify CLI + server work together
- [x] Type safety preserved across package boundaries

Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

topPRs.title: Add server, add tests
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR adds detailed tests to core, server, project-starter and plugin-starter

Project-starter and plugin-starter have had frontends added with cypress testing, to make frontend development easier and more clear

chore: release 1.0.11
fix: add __dirname for ES modules in copy-template utility
completedItems.body:
This PR fixes an issue where the `elizaos create` command was not properly copying templates due to missing `__dirname` in ES module context.

## Changes
- Added `fileURLToPath` import from `node:url`
- Defined `__filename` and `__dirname`

completedItems.title: fix: dont skip (single) installation test
fix: Add direct source path resolution for CLI templates in test environment
completedItems.body:
## Summary
- Fixes CLI test failures in CI environment by improving template path resolution
- Adds direct source directory path as the first option in template resolution logic
- Resolves ENOENT errors for project-starter and plugin-starte

completedItems.title: fix: cli test + bun-test migration
fix: scroll behavior on env panel
completedItems.body:
Currently, when importing a long list of environment variables into the secret panel, the user has to scroll all the way down to access the "Save" button.
This PR sets a maximum height and enables vertical scrolling to improve.


before

completedItems.title: fix: scroll behavior on agent settings
fix: ids should be uuid not text
completedItems.body:
## What does this PR do?

Fixes database schema by changing ID columns from `text` type to proper `uuid` type for better type safety and consistency.

## What kind of change is this?

Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Made significant documentation improvements with three open PRs (#5131, #5133, #5134) focused on accuracy, consistency, and descriptive comments, while also fixing CLI test failures through PR #5135 (+16/-2 lines). Contributed substantial code changes across 384 files (+69402/-3388 lines) in 30 commits, with primary focus on bugfixes (40%) and feature work (30%). Opened issue #5124 for Eliza Postman JSON updates and participated in discussions with 4 issue comments and 2 PR comments, while also providing 1 approval review.

ChristopherTrimboli: Merged two PRs this week, including a bug fix for agent thinking status (#5128, +16/-1 lines) and a significant type improvement PR (#5126, +1432/-1000 lines) that enforced strict CLI typing. Contributed a total of +1448/-1001 lines across 77 files while also approving 2 code reviews.

0xbbjoker: Merged 8 PRs this week with significant contributions to documentation (PR #5164: +2503/-974 lines) and character form improvements (PR #5186: +6784/-2214 lines), while also adding new features like agent settings (#5202), cascade deletion (#5171), and memory clearing (#5187). Actively participated in code reviews with 7 reviews and maintained consistent daily activity across the week, balancing bug fixes (55%) with feature development (40%). Currently has an open PR (#5205) focused on fixing unit and integration tests.

tcm390: Merged 13 PRs this week with a strong focus on GUI improvements and bug fixes, including significant work on chat title functionality (#5179, +210/-38 lines) and resolving several critical issues like GUI stuck problems (#5151, +121/-71 lines) and secrets handling (#5209, +515/-372 lines). Maintained very consistent activity across 5 days, contributing over 1,400 lines of code while addressing a diverse set of UI and functionality issues, particularly in media handling, environment settings, and agent interactions.

lalalune: Made a substantial code contribution by merging PR #5125 "Add server, add tests" which modified 224 files with +63,093/-3,694 lines of code. This significant feature work was completed in a single day, representing a major addition to the codebase with primarily new code being added rather than modifications to existing code.

yungalgo: Merged two PRs this week, including a CLI feature that consolidated the stop command into agent stop --all (#5175, +137/-142 lines) and a fix for plugin template dependencies (#5173, +22/-8 lines). Also opened a new PR (#5184) for adding monorepo guard with clear error messaging, with overall code changes spanning 29 files (+300/-154 lines) primarily focused on other work (53%) and feature work (35%).

standujar: Worked on enhancing CLI logging capabilities with an open PR #5203, making substantial code changes across 80 files (+2730/-1674 lines) with a focus on refactoring and test improvements. Engaged in discussions by commenting on 3 issues and 1 PR, showing occasional activity concentrated on a few days of the week.

monilpat: Currently working on the Quickswap plugin with two open PRs: a draft implementation (#5123) and a PR to fix compiler errors in the plugin tests (#5132). No merged contributions or other activity this period.

madjin: Led a major documentation refinement effort through PR #5182, which consolidated and improved docs with substantial changes (+18776/-16908 lines across 244 files). The work primarily focused on documentation (70%) and tests (22%), with activity concentrated on just 2 days this week.

snobbee: Merged a substantial refactoring PR #5232 "refactor(polygon): remove conflicts" that modified 24 files with +14540/-3840 lines of code. This significant code cleanup effort represents their only contribution during the period, focusing entirely on refactoring work.

Dexploarer: Opened one PR (#5195 "Add files via upload") with substantial code changes across 777 files (+51,705/-13,676 lines), active on only 2 days this week. The modifications were primarily focused on other work (76%) with some feature work (24%), touching test files (40%), code (26%), and documentation (22%).

0xCardiE: Fixed database connection error handling with PR #5235 (+110/-36 lines) which was merged after 7 hours, and has another open PR (#5196) addressing similar database-related issues. Active on 2 days this week, contributing a total of +247/-36 lines across 4 files with a focus split between feature work and other improvements.
github-advanced-security: Provided 2 review comments this week with no other activity. Their contribution was minimal during this period with no code changes, PRs, or issue activity.
cursor-com: Opened one pull request (#5178) focused on adding a comprehensive test suite with 93% coverage for the Alethea plugin, but had no other activity this week.
crypto-cooker: Opened one pull request (#5177) titled "Fix/summarized tweet interval issue" which remains under review. No other activity observed this week.

piffie: Identified and fixed a Windows-specific project loading issue by opening issue #5155 and subsequently merging PR #5156 (+5/-1 lines). The fix addressed problems with importing projects on Windows development machines, demonstrating focused troubleshooting and resolution of platform-specific bugs.

soyrubio: Merged a single bugfix PR #5148 that removed evaluators from the messageHandler prompt, making changes across 1 file with a net change of +0/-1 lines. The PR was of average complexity and took 9 hours to merge.

maximevtush: Fixed a typo in the Unfollow Room Action and a variable name in a plugin-related file through PR #5130 (+3/-3 lines). This was their only contribution during the week, with activity on just one day.

zeevick10: Made a small documentation improvement by fixing typos in the Plugin Documentation for Flow and MultiversX through PR #5127 (+2/-2 lines). This was their only contribution during the period, focusing entirely on documentation maintenance.
michavie: Fixed a bug in bootstrap evaluator callbacks with PR #5129, removing 9 lines and adding 1 line of code.

leopardracer: Made minor text corrections and consistency improvements through PR #5154 (+2/-2 lines) which modified 2 documentation files. This was their only contribution during the week, representing sporadic activity with focus entirely on documentation improvements.

GarmashAlex: Fixed a documentation link issue by updating the ElizaOS documentation URL to the new official address in PR #5162 (+1/-1 lines). This was their only contribution during the period, focusing entirely on documentation maintenance.
odilitime: Contributed through code review activities, providing 3 review comments and 1 PR comment. No code changes, PRs, or issues during this period.
alexjalonso7777: Contributed through code review activities, completing 2 reviews with 1 approval and 1 comment. No other GitHub activity was recorded during this period.

sicco-moonbeam: Created three new issues this week focusing on technical improvements: #5142 regarding test command requirements in the CLI, #5183 about customizing root logger configuration for downstream projects, and #5181 concerning advisory locking for the DatabaseMigrationService.

Megamindmaster: Reported one issue (#5228) regarding difficulties adding character JSON files in a fresh installation of v1.0.11, which has since been closed. Contributed to discussions by commenting on two separate issues.
paulmerz: Reported a single issue (#5161) about elizaos crashing after accessing localhost:3000 on Windows, which remains open.
urosognjenovic: Created issue #5198 regarding "elizaos update not working" which has since been closed.

furkannabisumji: Created two issues this week: #5117 in the bedrock component (now closed) and #5230 in the server component (still open). Contributed to discussions by commenting on three existing issues. No code changes or pull request activity during this period.
yasir23: Opened issue #5172 regarding Twitter not running with both plugin and client. No other activity this week.
Srenonno: Opened issue #5216 regarding "EVENT MESSAGE SENT not working" which remains open. No other activity was observed during this period.
